cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning north-northeast toward the southwest Louisiana coast and inland

weather_observation.warning_coast: West of High Island to Sargent, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX eastward to the Mississippi coast, with greatest impact in southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain-bands could bring brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 kt) during Friday daylight hours.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the upper Texas coast, including the Freeport area, mainly Friday daytime through evening.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches expected; locally higher amounts up to 5 inches cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will continue until the storm moves inland.
